structured.title: User Plays Mass Effect and Chats With Crew
structured.overview: The content is a mix of background radio-style talk and in-game dialogue from the video game Mass Effect. The user is controlling Commander Shepard aboard the SSV Normandy, talking to vendors about weapons and armor, receiving a job proposal from Nissana Dantius on the Citadel, and having a detailed conversation with pilot Jeff "Joker" Moreau about his flying skills and his medical condition, Vrolik syndrome. Joker explains his background, why he‚Äôs called Joker, and how the Normandy performs. The user then prepares to select squad members, commenting on their combat roles (soldier, shotgun, damage dealer) while planning the next mission.

Those given to me as charity for my disease.

transcript_segments.text: I've got ProLick syndrome, riddled bone disease. The bones in my legs never develop properly. They're basic hollow, too much force, little shatter. Even with and my leg braces, it's hard to get around. One wrong step and crack.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_9

transcript_segments.text: It's very dramatic. But I've learned to manage my condition, commander. Put the Normandy in my hands, and I'll make her dance for you.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_9

transcript_segments.text: Just don't ask me to get up and dance unless, you know, you like the sound of snapping shin bone.

transcript_segments.text: I need to know more about this Rolex syndrome if I'm putting my ship in your hands.

transcript_segments.text: Yeah. Of course you do. It's an extremely rare condition. Nobody knows exactly what causes it. Genetic may be. It's treatable, but there's no cure.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_9

transcript_segments.text: I classify my case as moderate to severe. I was born with Omi first year. Lucky for me, modern medical science has turned me into productive member of society.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_9

transcript_segments.text: I'm not trying to make Whatever you want, commander. How'd you end up joining the Alliance?
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_4

transcript_segments.text: Look, if you're looking for an inspirational tale of the crippled kid overcoming impossible odds, you're gonna be disappointed.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_9

transcript_segments.text: My mother was a civilian contractor working for the Alliance. I basically grew up on the airport station back in the '49 of fleet.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_9

transcript_segments.text: Why does everyone call you joker?
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_4

transcript_segments.text: It's a lot shorter than saying alliance flight lieutenant Jeff Moreau. Plus, I love to make little children laugh.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_9

transcript_segments.text: Used to bug me about never smiling. She started calling me joker.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_9

transcript_segments.text: Mhmm.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_7

transcript_segments.text: And stuck.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_9

transcript_segments.text: Why didn't she ever smile?
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_4

transcript_segments.text: Hey. I work my ass off in flight school, commander. The world's not gonna hand you anything if you go around grinning like an idiot. By the end of the year, I was the best pilot in the academy.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_9

transcript_segments.text: Even better than the instructors, and everybody knew it. They'd all got their asses kicked by the sickly kid with the creaky little legs. One guess who was smiling and graduation.
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_9

transcript_segments.text: How's the Normandy performing? Is she everything they said she'd be?
transcript_segments.speaker: SPEAKER_4

transcript_segments.text: She's the best ship in the fleet if you've got a pilot who knows how to handle her. Balance isn't what you'd expect. It takes a while to get used to that oversized drive core we got stuffed in back and our power can sneak up on you if you're not careful. The Normandy's probably too much ship for your average alliance pilot commander. Lucky for you, I'm anything.

transcript_segments.text: See you.

apps_results.content:
## Ship supplies and equipment  
- Commander offered non-Alliance weapons, armor, mods  
- Licenses cost seller significant money  
- Commander checks available gear before leaving  

## Incoming job offer  
- Nessana Dantius contacts Shepard with a job  
- Details withheld over unsecured comms  
- Requests meeting on the Citadel  

## Joker‚Äôs condition and background  
- Joker has Vrolik syndrome, brittle hollow leg bones  
- Condition is rare, genetic, treatable but incurable  
- Grew up on Arcturus Station, Alliance contractor mother  

## Joker‚Äôs skills and nickname  
- Top of class at flight school, best pilot in academy  
- Commendations earned, not charity for disability  
- Nickname ‚ÄúJoker‚Äù from mother teasing him for not smiling  

## Normandy performance  
- Normandy called best ship in the fleet  
- Oversized drive core makes balance tricky  
- Needs skilled pilot; Joker claims he‚Äôs uniquely suited  

## Squad setup and roles  
- Player preparing to disembark Normandy  
- One squadmate built as ‚Äúpure soldier‚Äù with shotgun  
- Another chosen for ‚Äúpure damage‚Äù role  

## Next steps  
- Meet Nessana Dantius on the Citadel for job details  
- Finalize squad composition and gear before deployment
